intro: Hieracium pseudophaulopum, commonly known as the false purple meadowhawk, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow to orange-yellow composite flowers, which are typically arranged in a single, showy head. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Hieracium pseudophaulopum is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
